quote.quote: Magic is a fickle thing. Use is poorly, things go wrong. Use it without conviction, things go wrong. Use it just right, somehow things might still go wrong.
quote.author: Tanya Tokevic, Anthropologist

background.name: Background
content: Magic is a mysterious force, one that is not yet fully understood. While all beings have magical potential, the use of magic appears to be reliant on the existence of a magical connection in the user’s world, more so than any innate aptitude. Even the most powerful of magical practitioners will find themselves powerless in a world where the threads of magic are disconnected from the Aether.

But even in the most magically inclined worlds, the exact nature of this force remains unknown, as the greatest minds study tirelessly to make any breakthrough. As such, magic remains a dangerous and risky force to use, but for many the potential benefits far outweigh such risks as users find themselves tapping into power that they had only ever dreamed of.

learning.name: Learning
content: In order to tap into one’s magical aptitude, they first must learn the basics. This isn’t something that one can learn simply through basic study or from a magical tome. You must first seek someone out who is willing to teach you to use this force (the Magical Affinity skill), as only they have the knowledge to fully open up the channels that will allow the threads of magic flow through you.
Once learned, new magical abilities can be accrued through leveling up, progression of story, and feats of strength.

magicalMayhem.name: Magical Mayhem
content: Magical Skills provide a lot of power and versatility, but they are not without their drawbacks. Magic is a fickle thing, and the magical threads that bind the world together are only meant to be stretched so far.

When a magician overuse their connection to these magical threads, they run the risk of tearing these threads apart momentarily, causing Magical Mayhem. When this happens, strange energies leak in the world from the Aether before the magical seams of the universe can repair themselves. The effects of this leakage range from mild inconvenience to life-threatening dangers.

causing.name: Causing Magical Mayhem

content.name: Failing with magic to a very high degree
sub: When the final result of a Mystic Test for any spell is less than half the spell’s required Mystic Test value (rounded down).
Rolling a critical fail when using a magic skill.

content.name: Using two spells in one turn
sub: Sustaining a spell does not count towards this

content.name: Using three of the four actions you have over two turns on spells (ex. One Action one turn, Two Actions next turn)
In one round, if 10 actions are spent using magic by any number of characters (DM should keep track with a d10).

causing.post: Typically, Magical Mayhem cannot be stopped. Legends speak of powerful magicians halting the process, but officially there are no reports of this ever happening.

chart.name: Magical Mayhem
chart.note: Aether Marks cannot be used to change your roll.

body.name: Time Dilation
body.description: Time seems to ebb and flow, as you momentarily fall out of its influence
body.effect: You lose your next One Action

body.name: Aether Sickness
body.description: All sentient beings near the caster feel their magic being drained.
body.effect: All characters within 30 feet the Caster (them included) have their Magic reduced to 0 and are unable to cast spells until after the Caster’s next turn. They also lose all sustained magic and their Armor loses its permanent magical properties for this time.

body.name: Farsight
body.description: The tearing open of the Aether has given the Caster a glimpse of what lies beyond the known universe. They immediately forget the experience, but it does not leave them unchanged.

body.name: Aether Shock
body.description: The Caster has stared into the eyes of a terrible beast that exists between dimensions.

body.name: Hellscape
body.description: The sudden influx of magical energies alters the very fabric of the world for a few moments, turning the world around the battle into a nightmarish place.
body.effect: All characters who are not blind, dead, or unconscious roll a willpower check. (1d20 + WP). If the result is lower than 14, they are feared. During their turn, they must spend a half action on a willpower check, until they are alleviated of their fear. Special skills can protect against this. A critical failure on any willpower roll leads to a “Mental Changes’ roll, which gets added to their character sheet.

body.name: Hulking Strength
body.description: Caster feels and influx of strength
body.effect: Caster gets +2 STR and -2 DEX for 3 rounds.

body.name: Aether Shifting
body.description: Caster suffers from the Fate of the Waygate as energies flow into their body
body.effect: Caster rolls against the Fate of the Waygate chart in Chapter 1 and adds the result to their character sheet.

body.name: Seer Soul
body.description: The essence of lies and deceit fills the Caster
body.effect: The caster gains the “Casandra’s Reputation” special skill.

body.name: Blood Rain
body.description: Blood rains down from the sky
body.effect: Blood rains down from the sky.

body.name: Symbiotic Essence
body.description: Something crawled out of the Aether and latched itself onto you
body.effect: Caster gains the “Symbiotic Essence” special skill.

body.name: Magic Amplifier
body.description: Everyone on the battlefield can feel the very essence of magic coursing through their veins
body.effect: Until end of combat, all characters on the battlefield get +5 Magic. Magical Mayhem cannot occur.

body.name: Seeing Red
body.description: The caster feels a sudden surge of fury
body.effect: The Caster gains the “bloodlust” special skill.

body.name: Weapon Shatter
body.description: The caster's weapon explodes in their hand
body.effect: All weapons that the Caster is currently wielding are destroyed. The Caster takes 1d8 damage, and is now unarmed.

body.name: Disappearing Act
body.description: The Caster blinks out of existence for a moment
body.effect: The Caster blinks out of existence for a moment. They will return to the battlefield in the same spot at the start of their next turn. They are now disengaged with all enemies.

body.name: Fate of the Waygate
body.description: The energies of the Waygate flood into the material plane
body.effect: All characters within 100 feet of the caster each roll against the Fate of the Waygate Chart in Chapter 1 and take whatever effect is given.
